KSL Hotel & Resort
7.6 Very good
Based on 23036 reviews

Had an unpleasant stay. Room was not what i asked for when i asked for smoking rooms. When asked after we went to the rooms, they said it will be a different room.

They had a spa downstairs but when asked to help us book, they said calling is chargeable and that we can use our handphones to call. Wifi had very bad connection and kept logging off. The room's fridge was not cold, the wallpapers were peeling off and bedsheets and blanket had stains on it, there was even a stain that looked like blood stains. I had rashes/bed bugs bites sleeping on the bed. We could hear people opening and closing the door and it was disturbing. Bathtub had brown unsightly stains as well. The door handle was spoilt so i had trouble opening from inside the room Everything was chargeable. Overall a very very bad experience even though location was good.

Show more
Crystal , Singapore
Hotel Jen Puteri Harbour
8.3 Excellent
Based on 2993 reviews

I stayed here to celebrate my partner's birthday & im glad I made the right choice! We were told that I stayed here to celebrate my partner's birthday & im glad I made the right choice! We were told that the room we booked was unavailable for the day & we got a free upgrade from the management.

This hotel also provide a complimentary birthday deco service & a birthday cake for my partner when I emailed them that I am going to celebrate my partner's birthday during the stay. The emails send for enquiries were promptly reply. We are soo thankful for this! The complimentary cake is big btw. I'd like to extend my gratitude to the team, especially Liza & Jo Yii for preparing the room deco for us. We appreciate it so much! This hotel has a very nice infinity pool and a calming view. The breakfast was superb! The stay here is absolutely worth it! Thank you so much team for your good service. I am definitely a very pleased guest. the room we booked was unavailable for the day & we got a free upgrade from the management. This hotel also provide a complimentary birthday deco service & a birthday cake for my partner when I emailed them that I am going to celebrate my partner's birthday during the stay. The emails sent for enquiries were promptly reply too. We were soo thankful for this arrangement! The complimentary cake is big btw. I'd like to extend my gratitude to the team, especially Liza & Jo Yii for preparing the room deco for us. We appreciate it so much! This hotel has a very nice infinity pool and a calming view. The breakfast was superb & many choices! The stay here is absolutely worth it! Thank you so much team for your good service. I am definitely a very pleased guest.

Show more
Ishqi , Singapore
Doubletree by Hilton Johor Bahru
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2605 reviews

We checked in 24th June 2017 for two rooms, one with my daughters, room 2304 and another, my other daughter and her friend at room 1415.

The check in staff's (Chinese girl) attitude was poor - told us room will be ready at 4pm when we checked in at 3pm (the actual time) and gave us a complimentary $100 voucher to use while the rooms are being readied. I was so tired and not in the mood to wait!!! And she told me, no free wifi because I didn't book directly with Hilton website but through third party!!!!!! No one told me this. If that is true, next time all of us just book direct with Hilton! The 23rd floor is HH floor, but it smelt of cigarette and the room had strong cigarette odour. I informed Tammie, upon my check out on 25th June and she was very apologetic about it. Kuddos to Tammie who helped to soften the frustrations I had with the check in totally unpleasant girl. Yesterday, my daughter and her friend at room 1415 shared with us the snatch thief near to AMMA restaurant on the motorbike. The rider snatched their shopping bags and rode off. It was a good thing only the shopping bags and nothing else, although the bag contained branded goods. They walked back from City Square shopping centre to Hilton =(. The street lamps should be enhanced and the area seemed quite and deserted in the night. Hotel should caution guests not to walk back from the City Square/Komtar shopping centre. The incident happened about late 8pm. Having shared the above, I like also to say thanks to the great service staff at the Italian restaurant =)

Show more
Kathryn , Singapore
Grand Paragon Hotel Johor Bahru
7.6 Very good
Based on 6336 reviews

First time stay here, Booked a deluxe room (newly renovated) with breakfast using Agoda. Checked in at 3pm and the unpleasant staycation started.

Was given a deluxe room that looks old. Cons: old room with no remote control for the a/c, got to wake up middle of the night walk to the door entrance to adjust room temperature. Limited space to put your toiletries at the shower area and shower pressure is low. There are 2 lift lobbies and I was given an old room with no direct access from the lift to the pool, need to go to ground level, walk to another lift lobby to get to the pool at level 11, and imagine you are wet after a swim. The pool is small, differs from the pics, not for a decent swim or workout. The worst part is day and night I could always hear water draining off to the drainage and it can be disturbing at night. There is a notice in the toilet that says under the penal code, theft is a crime and can be prosecuted. (Come on! Lol) Next day at 11am, I called and asked the front desk if I could have a late check out at 12.30pm? The staff told me I can check out at anytime before 1pm. But at 12.15pm, I received a call from a staff asking me what time am I going to checkout? Pros: Spacious, clean room with decent gym facilities. Breakfast is above average. Conclusion: For the price that I'm paying, the room and service are not up to my expectations, it's not value for money, I will not return unless the rate is lower. For the same rate that I have paid, I will go to Hxxxx Vxxx Hotel instead. 😊

Show more
Lim , Singapore
Mutiara Hotel Johor Bahru
7.8 Very good
Based on 6029 reviews

To be frank, I'm pretty disappointed with the hotel room. I have booked a Deluxe room and realised that the wall has been vandalised, most probably drawn by kids using pens.

Then there's a huge burnt patch on the iron board. The tile on the washroom basin is stained. The sides on the bathtub are also stained and mouldy. I was shocked by the standard as the review is quite high at 7.8 and was awarded top choice in Agoda in 2015. Immediately and for the 1st time after staying in many hotels, i asked for a change of room. Good thing they changed and upgraded the room for me to Executive room. But there is still a little problem where the water got clogged in the water basin. The gym is actually pretty small and swimming pool is okay. The good thing about this hotel is that the breakfast is good and reasonable where there are many choices of food. Other than that, the hotel is near the KSL Mall which is a plus point.

Show more
Hannah , Philippines
Thistle Johor Bahru Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 6674 reviews

Me and my wife spent out staycation anniversary here. It was last minute kinda thing as my leave was approved at the 11th hour.

I asked the front staff upon checking in. If there is anything can be done for me considering its our anniversary i was willing to pay for it. However she was quick to respond with a NO. I work in the service industry as well, there is never a NO, its if the staff wants to go the extra mile. Like I said i was willing to pay. I even asked if there was a nice place for us for sit down dinner as i noticed the buffer dinner was in full swing. Too noisy for my liking. Her response is gold, said you can try the mamak opposite the mainroad. I blame it on ignorance rather than her being sarcastic. I left for dinner elsewhere, came back checking into the room and it had a bad odor as if the room was mouldy. We called front desk and they suggested a room change. We were to tired to go thru the motions, i suggested to just spray some air refrreshener and i will seee how it is. If better leave it if not we will think about the change. Luckily that did the trick. Love the view bed pillows, shower pressure and shower space.

Show more
HARWIN , Malaysia
Amari Johor Bahru
8.8 Excellent
Based on 398 reviews

1) Location It is super convenient & very close to CIQ with just Komtar JBCC across the street. Within walking distances to the hip cafes down at Jln Dhoby & surrounded by shopping centres around, its truly a great place to be situated at if you love shopping.

2) Hotel Upon arrival, from the concierge to the front desk to the bell hop as well as the restaurants, i was greeted with warmth, smiles and a pleasant hospitality that is a kin to how the Thai hotels greet their guests. It made me feel so welcomed. The waiting lounge was nothing short of impeccable with its beautiful library full of books and top notch PCs with internet to a pool table for guests to interact with while waiting for their check-in. Every part of the hotel makes for an instagram worthy picture. 3) The room was huge! And it was incredibly beautiful! With a nice lounge chair, a work desk, a console that kept not only the minibar but the kettle, cups & TWG tea away to make the room clutter free. The room was equipped with a hair dryer, iron & ironing board so there's no need to pester to loan one. That king size bed is really luxurious to sleep in. If you don't really soft pillows, you might want to ask for more. The pillows were too soft for my liking. 4) Service I spent my birthday there & requested the room to be decorated. This part is one I am slightly disappointed it. Although I received a big cake that I adore & was complimentary (it was so yummy!), paying rm150 for just helium-filled balloons and a small banner on the bed to say Happy Birthday didn't cut it for me. There are so much things that can be done rather than just balloons for that price. 5) Restaurant Just check out their Facebook & you can see yourself drooling everywhere! It is exactly as what it is. I spent 2 hours sitting for breakfast & I still haven't tried everything that was made available. Everything was simply marvelously cooked to perfection in my opinion of course. Overall, would I come again

Show more
Nur , Singapore
Amerin Boutique Hotel Johor Bahru
7.8 Very good
Based on 1277 reviews

A very new hotel with friendly staff, I mentioned that NO CORNER ROOM for me but as the hotel are fully booked so the first night I was staying in a corner room which I dont really like it but they changed a new room for me for second night stay.

Cleanliness 5star, room was quite ok but not too big. Just the aircond problem, as management control the aircond temperature and the lowest was 21 degree and it was like OMG so hot! When we ask the staff to come inside to our room, he ask us to go outside for 5minute then go into the room again, then we will feel cold. Speechless! So for the two nights we sleep wihout using the blanket. But overall was ok

Show more
Tiew , Malaysia
New York Hotel
7 Very good
Based on 3204 reviews

Do not be duped by the room or hotel photo shown. Hotel is old with poor furnishing and dirty (old dark towels, dirty carpets).

I was given a smoking room which reeks with strong cigarette smell. Housekeeping went to the room and spray some perfume which does not even covered up the smell even a little. I requested for a room change to a non smoking room and was informed room change is not possible unless i pay for an upgrade. Booked for 2 nights stay and checked out immediately after first night of forced sleeping as i checked in at 1.00am. Kudos to agoda for their great service in cancellation of my second night booking with full refund. NEVER stay in this hotel. The worst hotel i have ever stayed in Malaysia.

Show more
Christophe , Malaysia
Berjaya Waterfront Hotel
6.8 Good
Based on 5481 reviews

We booked the hotel on 30 April and check in close to 1am, 1 May. When we reached the hotel, we were told by the staff that we will have to wait for our room as they do not know when their housekeeping will finish making the beds.

We waited aside and after 20 mins, I went up to the reception again to ask how long more do we need to wait for our room, as it's past midnight.. we purposely check in later in view of the PH and was tired by then. We were then given a room after 10 more mins of waiting. When we entered the room, we tried to order room service through the phone beside the bed but phone was dead. We then use the cranky phone in the washroom to dial, after which the phone died off too when we try to call the reception again for towel, as there were none in the room. When the room service arrived, we inform him that the 2 phones are down and that we need him to convey message to housekeeping for towels. Nothing happened. When we were checking out, it took us 45 min

Show more
Surene , Singapore
Grand Bluewave Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 5773 reviews

We have done booking almost 1 month early with saying we want a high floor with baby court and once we check in they give us room 1819 and the card was not usedable to enter the room and my i went dont to get help from the staff on this matter they make us to wait 20 min infront of the room door and then they have to used mannual key to enter the room and once we enter and acess the toilet it was licking and the toilet was so sleepry and unable to flush once we try to flush again there is alarm sound all over our room and can be hear till the lift area it has been witness by one of the bell boy as well.

i go down again and informed the situation and the staff never even say sorry for all this incident and he was being so sacastic saying things that actually almost pist me off.i am a 6 month pragnant woman with my 2 kids i think my stay should not be this horrible. We been tranafer to room 813 and when i say i req for a high floor they just say only this avlable wana take just take it or

Show more
kermajit , Malaysia
Baguss City Hotel
7.1 Very good
Based on 3429 reviews

The pros are: Good for 1 or 2 nights stay. Toilet is clean, bedsheets are clean. However we prefer family, queen or king room rather than the studio suite.

The carpet in studio suite looks quite old and the position of the beds are not well proportioned to the aircon. Feels quite stuffy as the one of the aircon in the room is not too strong.. the aircon shld be positioned slightly inwards towards the wall so that it blows at the right angle so we can sleep comfortably.. The breakfast spread has changed this time. Just simple toast, fried rice, hotdogs, omelletes, and 1 more local dish like soto or lontong.. Prefer the breakfast meal that we used to have at level 1..

Show more
Mohamed , Singapore
Citrus Hotel Johor Bahru by Compass Hospitality
7.1 Very good
Based on 7075 reviews

This property is located in an exceptionally good location near a couple of well run local malls right next to the Causeway that links Malaysia with the City State of Singapore.

For public transport users, the location is very tough to top being very close to JB Sentral Railway Station and Bus Depot. For KTM Shuttle train users, the hotel is 5-10 mins on foot to the Custom, Immigration and Quarantine House where a traveler has to go first, before doubling back to the station to catch the train without passing through the CIQ wickets. Despite having a breakfast that would be best described as bizarre, the staff, facilities and overall condition of the hotel warrant a possible repeat visit in the future despite the somewhat dicey area that is common around most major transport hubs.

Show more
David , United States
Erica Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 1795 reviews

Change the bed sheets, customers are not dumb , they can see there is hair and stains , body felt itchy as well.

Cant sleep . Luckily theres a male staff who willing to help. What others doing ?? I need to beg them to change for me, they seems abit rude and ignore my problem. My body was itchy and I can't sleep during that night . It was my first time amd my last time to visit Erica hotel ever. Some of the staff r good some r rude and lazy . while u at the front desk, help the customers and be polite . Im asking you in a good way and pls reply with good manner. Im very dissapointed. Felt regretted staying here for 3 days. Should have book for 1 day first , then second day I can shift to other hotel. ERICA HOTEL ,PLEASE DO SOMETHING . ITS REALLY BAD. VERYYYYY

Show more
ming , Malaysia
The Leverage Business Hotel (Skudai)
8 Very good
Based on 1079 reviews

The hotel is new and clean, room is comfort and full with all the necessary stuff (hair dryer, shampoo, small fridge, safe, and even ironing board.

.etc). One downside is no sound proof at all, while I was taking nap at around 4.30pm, I kept being wake by the loud noise of room door open & closing. And I could clearly hear their staff walkie-talkie inside my room! Hopefully hotel could do something on the sound proof. Although there is no designated car park, but the area is quiet so you could easily find parking either few shops away from hotel or the alley at the back, safety wise is another issue :)

Show more
Chee , Malaysia
M Suites Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 3896 reviews

I stayed here for 2 nights with the thought to spent time with the kids at the hotels cool swimming pool.

However, the cleanliness of the room/bathroom is too horrible for me to swallow in. The shower wall and sink rimms was fill with moldy (which can be easily clean with a simple scrub. How hard it is to have a clean shower area? 2nd, I had call the hotel at 5:00pm to inform I will be checking in late, I have also remind them to get the extra bed which was booked to be ready in the room. I have arrived at the hotel at 10:30pm. Feeling tired and upon check-in , checked at the reception again if the extra bed was prepared, bluntly answered we will sent up.. (even I have call and reminded - nothing is been prepared) Waited about 25mins to get the extra bed. Sent by a guy who doesnt look like he is from housekeeping and he came into the room area with his shoes on. (slap on the forehead). I have asked him to take off his shoes, he doesnt seem to understand english, and I have ask him to leave the bed. When I ask is housekeeping is coming he said, housekeeping already gone home. If Hotel doesn't have housekeeping at night - why didnt they ensure requested bed is prepared prior services leaving for the day? If you are staying for a night. Its okay. But paying for 700++ for 2 nights with a family. I recommend to find a nicer hotel if you have the same budget.

Show more
Shafenaz , Malaysia
Renaissance Johor Bahru Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 868 reviews

I booked 2 rooms from 11-12 Feb. Due to unforeseen family commitments, we only managed to check-in at 12am.

Check-in was a breeze and the staff allowed free late check-out at 2pm. The room is what's expected of a 5 star hotel. Clean, comfy bed and Tokyo Milk toiletries with latest hairdryer, iron, etc. You'll also get Nescafe normal and decaf 3 sticks each and Sir Thomas English and Green Tea, 2 each. Acceptable for a 1 night stay. But the highlight of our stay in Renaissance is the buffet breakfast. It differs from other hotels because of the unique spread. It's not that huge but it has cooks that are on standby, waiting to serve and cook on the spot for you such as grilled meats Mongolian style, Tepanyaki meat, seafood and veges, Mamak style roti prata, poori and dosai. For beverages, there's tea tarik or milo tarik made on the spot upon request just like when you ask for omelette (btw, the omelette is marvellous) and you can also get fresh fruit juices made upon request too. The bread section doesn't impress me though. A couple of multi-grains, croissants and sweet pastries. And sadly, they forgot my favorite donut. *sobs* Oh, for the kids, there's ice-cream with toppings such as shaved coconuts, chocolate chips, nuts, chocolate rice, etc. Parking is quite convenient and they have a 24 guard on duty. You just need to validate your ticket at the counter and the auto-machine at the lift-lobby whenever you need to leave the hotel. Swimming pool is normal. But their gym is open 24 hours. *smiles* Although the hotel looks old on the outside, but the inside is acceptable.

Show more
Aini , Singapore
V8 Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 791 reviews

I have never experienced this horrible staying at this fully new big hotel in the town. i checked in about late night 9pm, quickly went shower, and headed out dinner with old friends and came back to hotel room about 3am mid night.

when the time i got into bed only i realized the bedsheet smell other ppl perfume. Later checked the bedsheet, there was some hairs, and i surely they didn't changed the bedsheet, and pillow cases. And i called, they answered me, so do you want to change room? it was mid night 4am, I was really tired. The reception sounded like he knew the bedsheet didn't change, i think it is not the fault from staffs, this is the way how the management set the policies. Ended up i requested a new sheets to cover my bed, so i could sleep couple hour b4 i checked out. I told and showed the pic to the V8 staff about the issue last night when i checked out, and their answer was " ok , i will check with housekeeping" . That's it! what an unexpected and irresponsible service to your hotel guest! Jesus! I went to the cheapest hostel or backpacker, at least there is a clean sheets for me, and i feel save to sleep in. I RATHER PAY LESS TO SLEEP IN BACKPACKER WITH CLEAN BEDSHEETS AND TOWEL, BUT NOT RATED 4/ 5 STARS HOTEL WHICH GAVE ME FEELING SICK OF SLEEPING AT USED SHEETS.

Mei , Malaysia

The first hiccup, the room's aircon gave problems that led to the entire floor being wet, so we had to change to another room on the second day.

But the staff was nice enough to give us a free upgrade to a premium room. However, the premium room didn't seem to have much difference in terms of size, in fact, the bed seemed smaller compared to the deluxe room. The second hiccup, the cards to the new room was not activated so we couldn't get in and had to go back to the counter to get it activated and the worst part is on the next day the card got deactivated again and we had to go back to the counter to get it reactivated. Despite the staffs being very polite and accommodative it will be better for them to either service their computer system that activates the card if that was the cause of the problem or to retrain the staff of card activation if it was the staff's inexperience to use the system. The first good thing about the hotel is, of course, the strategic location, it's so conveniently located in the middle where it's about 6mins walk to City Square Mall and 6mins walk to the cafe area. You have coffeeshops opposite, 7 Eleven next door and Meldrum Night Market is behind. The second good thing is for the price paid and for a 3-star hotel, it is actually very well maintained. it's quite clean. A few things to take note, no room slippers, and no hair dryer, however, hair dryer was provided upon request. The third good thing is despite all the hiccups, the staff is polite, accommodative and even returned our shades which we absent-mindedly left behind when we checked out. In conclusion, I would still recommend this hotel but it would be better if the hotel management can do some maintenance to the aircon to avoid the above-mentioned problem in the future.

The overall ambience was good enough for a quick and simple weekend staycation. It was interesting to note that the top floor of the hotel housed the "executive lounge"; a cluster of tables and chairs at the lift lobby, with a couple of flipboards.

And all in the open, with no definite meeting room. The room was simple, adequately furnished, but there was only one set of the toothbrush & toothpaste. The general response time was good as well, better than some of the hotels I've stayed in Singapore. The breakfast venue and its food options was disappointing. Overly cramped tables and chairs across the dining area, a few dishes on display were already running out and were not topped up yet. There was just one chef on the floor, and three service staff running the entire cafe. Though I'm fine with a less than desired breakfast spread, I guess it's more or less justified by the price you pay for an overnight stay. The checkout wasn't efficient at all. There were only two front counter staff, and it was obvious there was a huge group of people queuing to checkout. I had a wait almost 30 minutes just to do my checkout. If you're looking for a no frills, simple, quiet hotel, this is one you can go to. But if you're pickier than others, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

More about Johor Bahru

Johor Bahru is an important manufacturing and business hub for Malaysia just over the causeway from Singapore. This city isn’t known for drawing in droves of visitors, but it is a popular destination for Singaporeans, especially those traveling to shop. The city is served by both Senai International Airport and, across the border, Singapore's Changi Airport, and is linked to its neighbors via several arterial roads and sea ports. BR> Johor Bahru has several large malls, and as a manufacturing hub, goods are generally cheaper than in nearby Singapore. AEON Tebrau City Shopping Centre is a short drive from the city center and features several large chains and a cinema complex. Close to the Causeway is Holiday Plaza, offering discounted prices on electronics. Travelers can find handmade goods at the Johor Area Rehabilitation Organization Handicraft Centre.

When not shopping, modern and historical landmarks are popular sites to visit. A former palace, the Royal Abu Bakar Museum offers a glimpse into the lives of Johor’s royals within the grounds of a well-manicured garden. The Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception, built in 1883, is one of the oldest structures still standing in the city.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Johor Bahru for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

This city isn’t known for drawing in droves of visitors, but it is a popular destination for Singaporeans, especially those traveling to shop. The city is served by both Senai International Airport and, across the border, Singapore's Changi Airport, and is linked to its neighbors via several arterial roads and sea ports. <>BR> Johor Bahru has several large malls, and as a manufacturing hub, goods are generally cheaper than in nearby Singapore. AEON Tebrau City Shopping Centre is a short drive from the city center and features several large chains and a cinema complex. Close to the Causeway is Holiday Plaza, offering discounted prices on electronics. Travelers can find handmade goods at the Johor Area Rehabilitation Organization Handicraft Centre. When not shopping, modern and historical landmarks are popular sites to visit. A former palace, the Royal Abu Bakar Museum offers a glimpse into the lives of Johor’s royals within the grounds of a well-manicured garden. The Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception , built in 1883, is one of the oldest structures still standing in the city. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Johor Bahru for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
